contentrichtext.text: {{main|ISO 3166-2}} '''ISO 3166-2:AF''' is the entry for [[Afghanistan]] in [[ISO 3166-2]], part of the [[ISO 3166]] [[standardization|standard]] published by the [[International Organization for Standardization]] (ISO), which defines [[code]]s for the names of the principal [[country subdivision|subdivision]]s (e.g., [[province]]s or [[state (administrative division)|state]]s) of all [[country|countries]] coded in [[ISO 3166-1]]. Currently for Afghanistan, ISO 3166-2 codes are defined for [[provinces of Afghanistan|34 provinces]]. Each code consists of two parts, separated by a hyphen. The first part is <tt>AF</tt>, the [[ISO 3166-1 alpha-2]] code of Afghanistan. The second part is three letters. ==Current codes== Subdivision names are listed as in the ISO 3166-2 standard published by the ISO 3166 Maintenance Agency (ISO 3166/MA). ''Click on the button in the header to sort each column.'' {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Code ! Subdivision name |- | <tt>AF-BDS</tt> | [[Badakhshān Province|Badakhshān]] |- | <tt>AF-BDG</tt> | {{sort|Badghīs|[[Bādghīs Province|Bādghīs]]}} |- | <tt>AF-BGL</tt> | [[Baghlān Province|Baghlān]] |- | <tt>AF-BAL</tt> | [[Balkh Province|Balkh]] |- | <tt>AF-BAM</tt> | [[Bamyan Province|Bāmyān]] |- | <tt>AF-DAY</tt> | [[Dāykondī Province|Dāykundī]] |- | <tt>AF-FRA</tt> | [[Farāh Province|Farāh]] |- | <tt>AF-FYB</tt> | [[Fāryāb Province|Fāryāb]] |- | <tt>AF-GHA</tt> | [[Ghaznī Province|Ghaznī]] |- | <tt>AF-GHO</tt> | [[Ghowr Province|Ghōr]] |- | <tt>AF-HEL</tt> | [[Helmand Province|Helmand]] |- | <tt>AF-HER</tt> | [[Herāt Province|Herāt]] |- | <tt>AF-JOW</tt> | [[Jowzjān Province|Jowzjān]] |- | <tt>AF-KAB</tt> | {{sort|Kabul|[[Kābul Province|Kābul]]}} |- | <tt>AF-KAN</tt> | [[Kandahār Province|Kandahār]] |- | <tt>AF-KAP</tt> | {{sort|Kapīsā|[[Kāpīsā Province|Kāpīsā]]}} |- | <tt>AF-KHO</tt> | [[Khowst Province|Khōst]] |- | <tt>AF-KNR</tt> | [[Konar Province|Kunar]] |- | <tt>AF-KDZ</tt> | [[Kondoz Province|Kunduz]] |- | <tt>AF-LAG</tt> | [[Laghmān Province|Laghmān]] |- | <tt>AF-LOG</tt> | [[Logar Province|Lōgar]] |- | <tt>AF-NAN</tt> | [[Nangarhār Province|Nangarhār]] |- | <tt>AF-NIM</tt> | [[Nimroz Province|Nīmrōz]] |- | <tt>AF-NUR</tt> | [[Nuristan Province|Nūristān]] |- | <tt>AF-PKA</tt> | {{sort|Paktikā|[[Paktīkā Province|Paktīkā]]}} |- | <tt>AF-PIA</tt> | [[Paktiya Province|Paktiyā]] |- | <tt>AF-PAN</tt> | [[Panjshir Province|Panjshayr]] |- | <tt>AF-PAR</tt> | [[Parwān Province|Parwān]] |- | <tt>AF-SAM</tt> | [[Samangān Province|Samangān]] |- | <tt>AF-SAR</tt> | [[Sar-e Pul Province|Sar-e Pul]] |- | <tt>AF-TAK</tt> | [[Takhār Province|Takhār]] |- | <tt>AF-URU</tt> | [[Uruzgan Province|Uruzgān]] |- | <tt>AF-WAR</tt> | [[Wardak Province|Wardak]] |- | <tt>AF-ZAB</tt> | [[Zābul Province|Zābul]] |} ==Changes== The following changes to the entry have been announced in newsletters by the ISO 3166/MA since the first publication of ISO 3166-2 in 1998: {| class="wikitable" |- ! Newsletter ! Date issued ! Description of change in newsletter ! Code/Subdivision change |- | id="I-6" | [http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_3166-2_newsletter_i-6_en.pdf {{nowrap|Newsletter I-6}}] | {{nowrap|2004-03-08}} | Addition of 2 provinces. Update of list source | style=white-space:nowrap | '''Subdivisions added:'''<br /> <tt>AF-KHO</tt> [[Khowst Province|Khowst]]<br /> <tt>AF-NUR</tt> [[Nūrestān Province|Nūrestān]] |- | id="I-7" | [http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_3166-2_newsletter_i-7_en.pdf {{nowrap|Newsletter I-7}}] | {{nowrap|2005-09-13}} | Addition of 2 provinces. Update of list source | style=white-space:nowrap | '''Subdivisions added:'''<br /> <tt>AF-DAY</tt> [[Dāykondī Province|Dāykondī]]<br /> <tt>AF-PAN</tt> [[Panjshīr Province|Panjshīr]] |- | id="II-3" | [http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_3166-2_newsletter_ii-3_2011-12-13.pdf {{nowrap|Newsletter II-3}}] | {{nowrap|2011-12-13}}<br /> ''(corrected<br /> {{nowrap|2011-12-15}})'' | Language corrections, administrative name corrections, alphabetical re-ordering and source list update | style=white-space:nowrap | '''Codes:'''<br /> <tt>AF-LOW</tt> Lowgar → <tt>AF-LOG</tt> [[Logar Province|Lōgar]]<br /> <tt>AF-ORU</tt> Orūzgān → <tt>AF-URU</tt> [[Uruzgan Province|Uruzgān]] |} ==See also== * [[Subdivisions of Afghanistan]] * [[List of FIPS region codes (A-C)#AF: Afghanistan|FIPS region codes of Afghanistan]] ==External links== * [http://www.statoids.com/uaf.html Provinces of Afghanistan], Statoids.com {{ISO 3166}} [[Category:ISO 3166|2:AF]] [[Category:Provinces of Afghanistan|*ISO 3166-2]] [[Category:Afghanistan-related lists]]
